page.title: 03Port Lympne House
page.content: The house was built by Sir Herbert Baker for Sir Philip Sasson, and finished just after World War I.After thirty years of neglect it has been lovingly restored by the present owner, Mr. John Aspinall, and is now open to the public. In the 1920's and 30's Sir Philip Sasson entertained the famous: political, theatrical, artistic and Royal. The house has fine rooms and terraces with spectacular views across Romney Marsh to the English Channel. The entrance hall has a floor of intricately laid black and white marble. There is a Moorish courtyard and a room called "The Tent Room" which is decorated over walls and ceiling with murals painted by Rex Whistler in 1933.
